result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Judicial Pretrial - in court on November 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Routed to Judge's JA
Routed to Judge's JA

for Bond Modification
Routed to Judge's JA
and Certificate of Appearance
and Certificate of Appearance

Final pre-trial on November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:00 PM Room 302 Defendant August D. Genz appeared by video in custody at LCJ.  Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie appeared in court for August D. Genz.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed motion. Defense notes defendants background. Defense asks court for bond modification to a $5,000 signature bond. Court questions defense of defendants ability to pay. Defense advises court of defendants financial income. Defendant would be staying in Antigo, WI. Defense asks for $300-$400 bond. Def would be residing with friend. State notes defendants prior record. State made offer to defense. State notes case can be scheduled for trial if need be. State objects to modification of bond. Defense notes defendant would sign waiver of written extradition. Defense had received offer and possibly negotiate. Defense notes defendant's monthly income. Def atty believes $350 is substantial sum of money for defendant. Defense advises court if granted a bond reduction, intention to withdraw speedy trial demand. Court makes remarks. Court denies bond modification. Bond remain the same. Court advises def of speedy trial. Defense asks for trial date. State recommends December 7th for jury trial. Final pre trial date Nov 21 @ 11:00AM. Def atty may appear by zoom.
Jury trial scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on September 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant's
Routed to JA
Routed to JA
(Routed to J.A. for Judge)
Routed to Judge's JA

2:03 PM Defendant August D. Genz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for August D. Genz.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court hears from Atty. Kaupie, has reviewed criminal complaint with Def. and waives further reading. Reserves rights and enters waiver of prelim examination. Will be filing bond modification. Court hears from State, proceeds to waiver of prelim hearing. Court reviews waiver with Def. regarding preliminary hearing. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and binds over. Information filed electronically, Atty. Kaupie has copy of information and waives reading and enters not guilty plea. Court receives not guilty plea. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
for bond modification (routed to Judge's JA)

10:23 AM Room 301 Defendant August D. Genz appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie appeared by video for August D. Genz.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. All parties via Zoom. Case is called and reviewed by the court. Motion was filed yesterday stating that a Court Commissioner is not able to modify bond. DA makes statement. Court reads statute. The Court orders hearing to be rescheduled to a later date with a Judge. Attorney Genz makes statement. Court is adjourned.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
regarding bond (routed to CC's JA)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.
Def. will need to sign waiver of extradition.

2:13 PM Defendant August D. Genz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. Def. would like to waive attorney rights.  Petition for court appointed atty completed not a waiver of attorney rights.  Def. wants to lower bond and does not need lawyer to modify bond.  Court questions def.  Def. wants an attorney.  Court will ignore petition for court appointed atty. State is fine with just doing bond hearing without counsel today.   Def. wants to proceed today with bond hearing without an atty.  Court will allow.  Court reviews history of complaint. Def. makes statement. State objects to signature bond and bond set is appropriate. Court gives 3 factors in setting bond and modifies $2,000 cash bond with same conditions and def. will sign waiver of extradition.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on August 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

3:53 PM Defendant August D. Genz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews history of case. Def. has called Public Defender several times.  Def. would like trial.  Waiver of atty and bond modification needs to be schedule. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
for bail reduction -Routed to CCJA

3:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelly L Hays in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant August D. Genz appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail. Def. appears by Zoom. Def. has contacted PD. but does not yet have counsel. Case Adjourned to July 18, 2022 at 1:30 p.m. Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/Bond
Maintain absolute sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.

1:56 PM/Rm. 301/Prosecuting attorney Kelly L Hays in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant August D. Genz appeared by video from Langlade Co. Jail.  Court Reporter by Zoom.  Def. has copy of complaint.  Court advises Def. of charges and penalties.  Court advises Def. of right to attorney and gives options.  Def. will contact public defender.  Bond recommendation by State.  Response by Def.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
